dashboard.name: 89b30edd-4c8d-4084-817c-8ede31c33d3b
dashboard.displayName: Corelight → Data Insights → Secure Channel Insights

dashboardCharts.name: 560c5c28-27cb-4368-a6b1-f3beb5ae0d70
dashboardCharts.displayName: SSH Inferences for Potential Security Risks

dashboardCharts.name: fd015ce4-96ae-49a2-a5ed-bdc94f2f1dea
dashboardCharts.displayName: Connections using Less Secure TLS Versions (< TLS1.2)
dashboardCharts.description: Connections employing TLS versions older than 1.2 are recognized as less secure, presenting a higher risk of being compromised. These outdated protocols may indicate legacy systems with configurations that are not aligned with modern security standards.

dashboardCharts.name: 69aaa0bc-e6a0-4f21-a642-3b5122f4de52
dashboardCharts.description: Helps to identify potential advanced threat indicators such as Client Authentication Bypass (ABP) and Reverse SSH tunneling activities (RSP, RSI, RSIA, RSL, RSK) for in-depth investigation.

dashboardCharts.name: 508bf32d-cbb8-4c5b-a8a1-c536bfd0610b
dashboardCharts.displayName: Network Evidence for Interactive Sessions and Keystrokes - SSH Inferences

dashboardCharts.name: c806a424-a14d-497e-b50f-2b2c2041833d
dashboardCharts.displayName: Network Evidence for All TLS versions seen
dashboardCharts.description: Classification Based on Industry Best Practices

dashboardCharts.name: ffcd22f9-8d16-4a15-bca6-138a7a0164cc
dashboardCharts.displayName: Less Secure Ciphers seen in the Period

dashboardCharts.name: 6b780bba-fc1e-46fd-a676-4f3618c72d06
dashboardCharts.description: This use case tracks SSH file transfer activity (inferences SFD, LFD, SFU, LFU). It uncovers potential data exfiltration by attackers or the introduction of malicious files. Focus on file names, sizes, unusual source IPs, and sensitive destination systems.

dashboardCharts.name: 774f0976-62ec-42f5-8a0c-1c59df10a502
dashboardCharts.description: Highlight interactive sessions (KS) and automated interactions (AUTO) to understand the nature of SSH traffic — manual vs. automated.

dashboardCharts.name: 8a26628b-eb6b-4a6c-84f6-96c9f8b3e414
dashboardCharts.description: SSL/TLS sessions utilizing weak cipher suites (eg. RC4) are easily decrypted. This traffic may indicate the presence of old and/or unpatched resources on the network. It could also be the result of a successful downgrade attack.

dashboardCharts.name: 95a66865-39dc-4f34-b649-43f4c23ecc09
dashboardCharts.description: This dashboard panel identifies self-signed certificates in use within internal networks, highlighting a key security concern due to their lack of third-party validation. Addressing this issue by transitioning to certificates from trusted authorities enhances network security and trustworthiness.

dashboardCharts.name: 03d5ca3d-7b08-4d2f-826c-672e170dae43
dashboardCharts.description: Tracks automated SSH sessions to enhance security and operational efficiency, highlighting potential risks and compliance issues. It identifies anomalies and unauthorized activities, ensuring that automation tools are used securely and efficiently. This tool is crucial for SOC analysts to monitor for security breaches and optimize system management.

dashboardCharts.name: 37f5687d-484f-45b7-94e9-1613af3565b3
dashboardCharts.description: Monitors for signs of scanning (SC, SP, SV, SA), banner messages (BAN), and agent forwarding (AFR) for compliance and security risk identification.

dashboardCharts.name: 06cce647-9e4b-4cc9-88e8-9351e471ceb6
dashboardCharts.displayName: Network Evidence for Self Signed Internal Certificates

dashboardQueries.name: daa647ed-b384-4588-98c0-63ee8b862380
dashboardQueries.query:
metadata.vendor_name="Corelight"
metadata.product_event_type = "ssl" 
$is_self_signed=if(security_result.detection_fields["validation_status"]="self signed certificate", "yes", "no")
$is_self_signed="yes"
network.tls.client.server_name!=""
$src_host_type=if(principal.ip in cidr %internal_cidr_list , "Internal", "External")
$dest_host_type=if(target.ip in cidr %internal_cidr_list , "Internal", "External")
$dest_host_type="Internal"
match:
    network.tls.client.server_name, target.ip
outcome:
    $validation_status=array_distinct(security_result.detection_fields["validation_status"])
    $dest_host_types=array_distinct($dest_host_type)
    $traffic_direction=array_distinct(if($src_host_type="Internal" AND $dest_host_type="External", "Outbound", 
                   if($src_host_type="External" AND $dest_host_type="Internal", "Inbound",
                   if($src_host_type="Internal" AND $dest_host_type="Internal", "East-West",
                   if($src_host_type="External" AND $dest_host_type="External", "Ether", "Undefined"
                   )))))

dashboardQueries.name: 28cb0304-1943-4a52-bacd-5a532def551e
ee5d3d06-c9f9-4203-98df-74cd47a43f30
0af93a5d-dfcf-4f6b-ac8f-3ef561c6dfa4
4f6d1618-1e61-4656-a1f8-0411edc823c0
314fac87-6efb-47f2-afe9-d8f1a9461abd
dashboardQueries.query:
metadata.vendor_name="Corelight"
metadata.product_event_type = "ssl" 
$is_self_signed=if(security_result.detection_fields["validation_status"]="self signed certificate", "yes", "no")
$is_self_signed="yes"
target.ip in cidr %internal_cidr_list
network.tls.client.server_name!=""
$combined_field=strings.concat(network.tls.client.server_name, target.ip)
outcome:
    $count=count_distinct($combined_field)

dashboardQueries.name: cd7db9ab-5be3-45bc-b4de-cb7dc0deb2ae
ccc86a78-1171-42dd-a491-bfe92f160c31
855c9b8a-0371-4e00-b824-c39eda43674a
84faf54b-403c-4fd2-9408-c7afabdb33e1
dashboardQueries.query:
metadata.vendor_name="Corelight"
metadata.product_event_type = "ssl" 
principal.ip!=""
network.tls.version!=""
$version_status=if(network.tls.version="TLSv13", "Most Secure", 
                if(network.tls.version="TLSv12", "Secure",
                if(network.tls.version="DTLSv12", "Secure",
                if(network.tls.version="unknown-64282", "Unknown", "Old Version"
                ))))
$version_status!=/.*Secure.*/
outcome:
    $count=count_distinct(about.labels["uid"])

dashboardQueries.name: 1801653e-31b0-4080-a3d2-07c50ef6bec9
6cdcbed4-808c-42e7-b1b5-9d2879ca761d
dashboardQueries.query:
metadata.vendor_name="Corelight"
metadata.product_event_type = "ssl"
re.regex(network.tls.cipher, `(RC4|DES|3DES|MD5|NULL|EXPORT)`)
$is_src_internal=if(principal.ip in cidr %internal_cidr_list, "true", "false")
$is_dest_internal=if(target.ip in cidr %internal_cidr_list, "true", "false")
match:
    network.tls.cipher
outcome:
    $dest_ip=window.last(metadata.event_timestamp.seconds, target.ip)
    $unique_conn=count_distinct(about.labels["uid"])
    $host_type=array_distinct(if($is_src_internal="true", "Internal", "External"))
    $directions=array_distinct(if($is_src_internal="true" AND $is_dest_internal="false", "Outbound", "Inbound"))
    $count=count_distinct(metadata.id)
order:
    $unique_conn desc, $count desc

dashboardQueries.name: 50c74e85-b165-400c-ad4b-007679112435
82fbff95-5651-4bfe-b3bc-781b90ec305e
616ccf05-8c7b-4f5c-8e26-037a33fc732c
dashboardQueries.query:
metadata.vendor_name="Corelight"
metadata.product_event_type = "ssl" 
principal.ip!=""
network.tls.version!=""
$src_host_type=if(principal.ip in cidr %internal_cidr_list, "Internal", "External")
$dest_host_type=if(target.ip in cidr %internal_cidr_list, "Internal", "External")
$version_status=if(network.tls.version="TLSv13", "Most Secure (v1.3)", 
                if(network.tls.version="TLSv12", "Secure (v1.2)",
                if(network.tls.version="DTLSv12", "Secure (v1.2)",
                if(network.tls.version="unknown-64282", "Unknown", "Old Version < (v1.2)"
                ))))
match:
    network.tls.version, $version_status, $src_host_type, $dest_host_type
outcome:
    $connection_type=array_distinct(if($src_host_type="Internal" AND $dest_host_type="External", "Outbound", 
                   if($src_host_type="External" AND $dest_host_type="Internal", "Inbound",
                   if($src_host_type="Internal" AND $dest_host_type="Internal", "Internal",
                   if($src_host_type="External" AND $dest_host_type="External", "EEther", "Undefined"
                   )))))
    $ip_class=array_distinct($dest_host_type)
    $count=count_distinct(about.labels["uid"])
order:
    $count desc
